page.title: 20TRANSPORT, LYNEMOUTH.
page.content: {BUSES. The bus service runs half-hourly through the village in each direction. During the day many of the buses are running with only a few passengers. {RAILWAYS.} A railway track bisects the village. At one time villagers used the train as another means of transport- this was known locally as the "Tankie". At the present time discussions are being held to draw up plans to remove the entire track and landscape tha railway area.This will provide another place where people can meet and pass the time of day.It should also change the complexion of the village quite dramatically. {HORSES.} Many of the men are involved in collecting sea-coal.Horses and carts are a normal part of our village life.
